Fields.DialogueText: Knock, knock.
Archimede, good morning. Is it morning? I don't actually know.
I tend to focus too much on my work to bother with the time of day. Here, I brought you some coffee. Caffe doppio.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you, but my shift ends in a few hours. I won't be able to sleep if I drink that.
Thanks, Archimede. You made it?
I'm not much of a coffee drinker, thank you.

Fields.DialogueText: Would it change your mind if I said I didn't make it?
I didn't, so you can wipe that worried look off your face. Capitano.
I didn't make it, Capitano.
Well, thank you, Archimede. These last few hours do drag on.
I am aware that I make terrible coffee, Capitano. If you're trying to protect my feelings, it isn't necessary.
I know, I know. Bad habits, flattery and all that.
Hmmm.
*ALARM*
Morganas? This close in?
Stragglers, possibly, or scouts.
Let's go ask them.
@BATTLE
Archimede, have you gotten a chance to go ashore yet?
I haven't, Capitano. You know I can't travel any significant distance from the ship.
Port Narrow may be small, but it's not a backwater. There is plenty to do and see just outside the ship.
I wasn't critiquing the port. I've just been busy.
It's a rare luxury to be assigned a port, not to mention brief. Go have some fun.
I'm having enough fun on board. Small talk and chumminess is more of a bother than an entertainment. For me, anyway.

Fields.MenuText: Then join me for dinner? Little restaurant just off the dock, no chumminess allowed.
I've got some time tonight to head out, and I'd like you to join me.
Archimede, don't be a stiff. Come out with me? We'll make a night of it.

Fields.DialogueText: Dinner? I suppose I can make time for dinner.
I won't promise I'll have fun, but fine.
I'm no stiff, Capitano. Fine, see if you can keep up.
Great, I am relieved...
*ALARM*
Morganas are approaching the perimeter, Capitano.
What are they doing? They must know they can't take the port with that many.
I don't have an explanation. Preparing to make way.
Let's go.
@BATTLE
Eureka! Haha.
What did you make, Archimede?
A business deal, can you believe it? Never saw myself as an entrepreneur.

Fields.MenuText: You've got my attention. So what happened?
Business deal? How are you going to run a business?
You're not planning a racket on board the ship, are you?

Fields.DialogueText: Furball-bat-bird-porcelaineyes is going into mass production! A new toy for a new era.
I won't be running it, just providing the schematics for Furball-bat-bird-porcelaineyes.
Of course, I never do a project unless crime is involved. No, it's Furball-bat-bird-porcelaineyes.
That disturbing toy you made... I knew... somewhere in my heart, I knew this would happen.
*BOOM*
Shot from the port side, Capitano!
Where did it come from!?
A moment... there! Morganas are inside Port Narrow's perimeter.
We'll figure out how this happened afterwards. Make way!
Yes, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Patrols around the port are picking up more Morgana vessels.
Yet each engagement is a skirmish. They're not committed to an attack.
*ALARM*
Skirmish or not, we can't leave them unchecked.
Agreed.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Archimede, I haven't seen the Morganas like this. It's like they are assessing us.
Archimede, do you know what they are up to?
Archimede, I need an explanation, whatever you have.

Fields.DialogueText: Their unpredictable behavior aside, you may be right.
It's difficult to determine their intentions, but their tactics do suggest they are assessing our defenses.
The best explanation, based on their behavior, is that they are determining Port Narrow's defensive strength, Capitano.
Port Narrow isn't a military outpost. It has no strategic advantage.
Maybe it has an advantage we aren't aware of?
There's nothing here, just people. But something's going on.
Capitano, the new defensive patrols we've devised are working. Morgana ships can no longer reach the port.
Good. Thank you, Archimede.
Capitano, I'm sensing Morgana vessels outside of the patrol net.
What are they doing?
They are stationary, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: Stationary? What do you think they're doing?
What are they waiting for?
Are they taunting us?

Fields.DialogueText: It appears they are waiting and watching.
I don't know. I hesitate to say, but it appears they are being patient.
It's possible, but there hasn't been any activity there. I doubt it's a trap.
If they think they can remain safe within our sights, they are wrong. Let's go.
Yes, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Huh.
Archimede, what are you doing with Furball-bat-bird-porcelaineyes?
Throwing it out, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: You can't do that!
Why?
I'd be lying if I said I wasn't relieved. Still, why?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sorry, Capitano, but I need to.
Because... it makes me sad.
I will also be relieved when it's gone.
Is this about the attack on Port Narrow? I heard some shops were destroyed.
Maggie Moretti, she was an odd little woman. Cantankerous, loud and brilliant. She lived in her shop.
I see...
I really can't make sense of it, but she loved Furball-bat-bird-porcelaineyes. It was her idea to make more of them. And with her gone, I just... I can't.
Archimede, may I hold onto it for a while?
Capitano?
You might feel differently about it, about what happened, later.
I want it gone... but I understand.
If you change your mind, I'll be there. Well, I mean, Furball-bat-bird-porcelaineyes will be there.
*ALARM*
Mmm-hmm. Shall we?
Yes, prepare to engage.
@BATTLE
Capitano, I must admit, I never found eggs exactly palatable. These eggs, on the other hand, are delicious. How did you convince Cookie to change her recipe?
I didn't.
Hmmm. Oh! The restaurant in Port Narrow?
Wrong again. I made them.
No, you didn't!

Fields.MenuText: I did so! I'm not a bad cook.
Honestly, I'm surprised as you are that they came out as well as they did. I'm... not the best cook.
I... can do things.

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't say you weren't. I've just never seen you cook before.
I seem to recall you eating the separate pieces of a sandwich, bite by bite, because you weren't sure how they went together.
Yes, you can. I recall one of those things is eating cold beans out of the can with the bent lid.
I do try to cook from time to time.
Why?
It just seems to be a good skill to have... especially if you're hoping to impress someone.
Hmmm... It worked.
*ALARM*
Good. Looks like we are back to work. Let's go.
Yes, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Archimede, we have more Morgana ships, sitting at the edge of our patrols.
*ALARM*
Yes, Capitano, making way.
@BATTLE
Capitano, has Command sent any new information?

Fields.MenuText: No, Port Narrow isn't exactly a priority. Our orders stand.
Frankly, they are as confused as we are. We're still to defend Port Narrow, that's all.
Defend the port. So no, nothing new.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe the Morganas are just acting a little more erratic than usual. Maybe there's no larger plan here.
I don't like being uninformed.
Of course. I hate a lack of information.
This feels different, Archimede. I know you don't like me basing decisions off of feelings.
They're not feelings, Capitano. They're intuition. I'm suspicious as well.
Then let's assume the Morganas are planning something and figure out our next move.
Archimede, did you send up this coffee?
I did, Capitano. You're enjoying it?
It's great. What is it?
Caffe macchiato. I made it.

Fields.MenuText: You did? I'm... a little shocked.
Really? But your coffee is... how did you make this coffee?
No, you didn't.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, to be transparent, I didn't exactly make the coffee.
I found a work around, as I usually do.
I did, quantitatively.
All right, what's the secret, then?
I built a coffee maker! It all came down to temperature, time, and measurements.
How is it you make terrible coffee, but you're capable of building a machine that makes delicious coffee?
The recipes are simple enough, but my mind wanders and I miss crucial steps. Then, eureka! A machine doesn't get bored. Ipso facto, coffee maker.
This is good, but we already have good coffee on board. Why go to all the trouble?
I made a point to have at least one delicious beverage at my disposal, to impress.
*ALARM*
It worked. Prepare to make way.
Intercept course set, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Archimede, have a look at this.
The Maliko Islands. Colloquially Malik's Chain.
There's a good story behind that name, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: Really? Tell me later. I need to make a point first.
I've heard it, Archimede. Here, look at the map.
Wait, I'm going to lose my thought here.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course. Continue, Capitano.
What am I looking for, Capitano?
I'm sorry, go on.
Port Narrow is the only inhabited island, mostly due to the mountains and cliffs that cover the rest of Malik's Chain.
Sì, it makes building any substantial settlement impossible.
But look at all of these ocean pockets the islands make; enormous sectors, completely concealed.
A lot of places to hide.
Exactly. I don't know what's there, but maybe the Morganas found a way to construct a port.
*ALARM*
Morganas pushing the perimeter, Capitano.
Right, let's move.
About the map - you're a genius.
@BATTLE
What's this, Archimede?
Would you stop snooping, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: Snooping? It was laying right here on your desk.
I wasn't snooping. Are they plans for a music maker?
There are papers lying all over, Archimede. I can't look at your room without snooping.

Fields.DialogueText: That is not an invitation to read it. Well, maybe it is.
No. If you must know, it is a sound imitation machine.
Point taken.
So these are plans? Diagrams?
Yes, I was planning on building it to imitate dolphin calls.
To try and speak with them?
No, nothing that intricate. We just haven't seen or heard dolphins in ages. I miss it.
So why haven't you built it?
I'm not finished with the designs. I also haven't had a lot of free time lately.
*ALARM*
Case in point.
When you get around to it, I would love to listen with you. Let's go.
Yes, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Archimede, Morganas on the perimeter.
Are they retreating?
... Damn. Pursue! Full speed!
Capitano... there's no point. They're already gone.
We lose them every time!
I'm sorry, Capitano, I don't have the means to pursue them indefinitely.

Fields.MenuText: I wasn't yelling at you, Archimede. I was just... sorry, I'm frustrated.
Don't apologize, Archimede. No one blames you.
There has to be something we can do.

Fields.DialogueText: I understand. We're all frustrated. Capitano, what if we stopped chasing and started tracking?
Sì, Capitano. If we can't pursue them, maybe we can track them.
We can't keep up, but maybe we can track them.
How do you suggest we do that?
I don't know yet.
Our conventional means of tracking won't work, so you'll...
... Just have to invent an unconventional means? Yes, Capitano.
I have no doubt you will. Get to it, Archimede.
Eureka! Eureka, Capitano!
What do you have, Archimede?
Nope, I get to do an introduction this time. Capitano, do you know how far whales can send sound?

Fields.MenuText: Far? I'm not sure, 30 leagues?
Well, a half a league? Maybe one?
Not far at all.

Fields.DialogueText: That would be the highest estimate... unproven, but yes.
No, much further - possibly up to 30 leagues.
That answer but the exact opposite, Capitano.
So let me guess: you have created something capable of imitating a whale's call and want to attach it to a Morgana ship.
Have you been snooping?
No, I just know you. It's going to get harder and harder for you to surprise me.
Hmmm.
Impress me, though... that you continue to do.
*ALARM*
Can I assume you have modified a torpedo to carry said device and it's ready to fire?
Ha! Yes, yes you can.
I have that smug smile again, don't I?
You do, but you can wear it a while longer. It's cute.
@BATTLE
Sweet of you to say, my dear Capitano!
You'd think she'd be easier to find the old-fashioned way...
*sigh*
Brbrbrbr! Brbrbrbr!
Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: Archimede, did you give some type of pill to the crew?
Archimede, what's this about a pill?
Archimede, I thought we spoke about doing experiments on the crew.

Fields.DialogueText: I did, Capitano, but they volunteered! It's for emergency situations, for evacuees.
It's a supplement, Capitano. I made it for evacuees, in case their supplies run low out at sea.
You make me sound like a mad scientist, Capitano.
What exactly is it?
It's amazing, really! I extracted nearly all the water from food and condensed the food into a single pill.
How much food?
Two days' worth! The pill is rather large, but it will keep someone well fed.
And when they drink water?
They'll drink it and... oh, no. Permission to leave and check on something, Capitano!
No need. The crew members who tried your pill are fine. It turns out they threw up before their stomachs exploded.
How could I have overlooked that!?
You were eager to help and got too excited. Please remember to run these inventions by me.
Always.
*ALARM*
Morganas, Capitano, at the perimeter.
Let's go. And Archimede, it's a brilliant idea, but maybe cut the size down.
Significantly!
@BATTLE
Capitano, we are clearing the cliff face. The origin of my device's signal should be visible any moment.
Keep us slow and quiet, Archimede. Whatever we find, I...
Capitano...

Fields.MenuText: Archimede? How many ships do you see? I can't count them.
That many Morganas? It's an entire fleet. How?
It's an armada. There are too many to count.

Fields.DialogueText: Neither can I, Capitano.
I have no idea, Capitano.
It's an invasion, Capitano.
Archimede, turn us around.
Morgana ships behind us, Capitano. They don't appear to be part of the main fleet.
*ALARM*
Push through! We need to get back to Port Narrow.
@BATTLE
Capitano, we haven't received a response from Command yet.
We won't; not in time, anyway. Our orders stand. Protect Port Narrow.
Capitano, may I inform the crew to... to prepare messages for their families?

Fields.MenuText: Archimede, we can make it out of this.
Not yet, Archimede. We're not dead yet.
Most of them did a long time ago, but they won't need them.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, I am with you. I don't need false hope.
Capitano, you know what defending the port means. Nevertheless, I'm standing by you.
Capitano...
We're not staying here. I want an evacuation plan in place as soon as possible. Everyone in Port Narrow.
Capitano, I don't disagree, but aren't we under direct orders to defend Port Narrow?
I said before, Port Narrow doesn't have any strategic advantage. Just people. They are Port Narrow.
So the only way to defend Port Narrow is to move it. I hope Command will be in a poetic mood.
They will. This is the right thing to do.
*ALARM*
Another small detachment of Cattive Ragazze.
@BATTLE
Archimede, you're back. How are the people of Port Narrow progressing?
Well enough, considering. They are deciding what they will take with them, due to the weight limitations.
It's unfortunate, but necessary. Still, it is a hard thing to leave behind so many memories.
Yes, and on that point, I would like Furball-bat-bird-porcelaineyes, please.
Happy to hear it! I will bring it to your quarters after my shift.
Thank you, Capitano, for everything. Have you been taking care of it?

Fields.MenuText: Of course! It's on my mantel, dusted and pristine.
As well as anything. I put it into storage.
It's fine. I chucked it under my bunk. Should still be there.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, Capitano, you really do like Furball-bat-bird-porcelaineyes!
Can't say Furball-bat-bird-porcelaineyes belongs in storage, but thank you.
Under YOUR bunk? I'll be cleaning him for weeks!
I did my part, and now it's time to say goodbye. May I ask what changed your mind?
I was helping with the salvage efforts. Some of our sailors went to Maggie's shop and found her plans - a series of machines that would build Furball-bat-bird-porcelaineyes.
Impressive. You helped her with those?
I didn't. Like I said, she was brilliant. I imagined her response to me throwing out Furball-bat-bird-porcelaineyes.
And?
Something to the tune of, "You as daft as you are scrawny? I'd cane them witless thoughts right out your ear if I were thirty years younger, I would."
Haha, she sounds charming.
*ALARM*
She wasn't. I adored her. Let's not let them take anyone else like that, Capitano.
Agreed. Set a course for the Morganas.
@BATTLE
Capitano, every vessel in Port Narrow is being outfitted and manned. It's precarious, but every person can be evacuated.
Good. And the perimeter?
Stretched thin but holding. The Morganas have not been close enough to see.
*ALARM*
Then let's keep it that way.
@BATTLE
Morganas cleared, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think this will work, Archimede?
We can do this, Archimede.
Archimede, what are the chances this works?

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, we will do everything we can. May we focus on that?
Yes, Capitano. I have nothing to say in opposition.
I'd rather not do those calculations if it's all the same to you, Capitano.
Right, no reason to expect the worst.
We still have a lot of preparations to make, and I doubt time is on our side.
I believe in you, Archimede.
Capitano...
I believe in you, too. *kiss* Let's get to work, shall we?
Hello, Archimede.
Any news?
Capitano, the Morgana fleet is approaching Port Narrow.

Fields.MenuText: Begin the evacuation now.
Make ready for battle.
Is everything ready?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Capitano, and I will make ready for battle.
Yes, Capitano. And the evacuation is underway.
Yes, Capitano, we are battle ready and the evacuation is underway.
Archimede, will Port Narrow's ships make it out in time?
The bulk of the Morgana force is moving slowly, but there are a few waves that will reach us before everyone is out.
Inform the evacuees to meet at the rendezvous point.
We are going to engage the Morganas?
That's right. Ready?
Yes, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Archimede, how long till we reach the rendezvous point?
At our current speed, we will be there in a matter of minutes, Capitano.
Where is the Morgana fleet?
Capitano, the majority of the fleet passed the island and is in pursuit. We have a small detachment approaching quickly.

Fields.MenuText: They're goading us into a fight to slow us down.
Hard stop. Let's take them by surprise.
Can we maintain course? Outrun them?

Fields.DialogueText: We may not have a choice, Capitano. They are gaining.
Yes, Capitano, bringing us about.
No, Capitano. They will be on us in a matter of minutes.
We will have to reach the rendezvous later.
If we don't end this quickly, the entire fleet will engulf us.
Understood. Archimede?
Yes, Capitano?
We're winning.
Yes, we are. Morganas in range.
@BATTLE
Capitano, we are in visual range of the rendezvous point.
They're still there! That's a relief. Hail them and apologize for our tardiness.
Yes, Capitano.
Capitano! Morgana detachment, heading towards the evacuees!
Go, Archimede! Put us between them and the Morganas.
@BATTLE
The evacuees are safe for now, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: Damage report, Archimede.
How are you holding up, Archimede? I don't mean the ship - I mean... you.
We're holding it together.

Fields.DialogueText: We are still seaworthy.
Battle ready. And I'm glad I've got you with me for all of it, Capitano.
Yes, Capitano, but we are reaching some limits.
We defeated the Morganas, but I fear our luck might be changing.
The battle most likely revealed our location to the other Morganas, sì.
Port Narrow's ships should continue on to the safe zone.
Some of the ships are saying they'd rather stay close to us.
We can't protect them from a fleet when we're the decoy. Please help them understand.
I will do my best.
Archimede, they are civilians, so handle with care. But they must listen to you. This isn't up to a vote.
I'll send it right... after we deal with this pack of Cattive Ragazze!
@BATTLE
Archimede, I'm picking up the evacuees. They are maintaining course for the safe zone.
Capitano, a large force of Morganas are incoming.
You're not kidding. Archimede, can we win?
I think we can delay them, at the very least... do we have a choice?
No, no we don't. Bring us around, make ready.
*ALARM*
Archimede, listen. I wanted to tell you, just in case we...
Nope! Bite your tongue. No, no, no.
What?
Capitano, we are not doing the cliché of confessing our feelings for each other in a dire situation.

Fields.MenuText: I'm speechless.
Sorry. Guess I went right for the cliché there.
That's rude, Archimede.

Fields.DialogueText: Good. Just take a breath.
No, no, Capitano, don't be sorry. I feel it, too, but... it's just bad timing for us.
I didn't mean to jump at you, but you caught me off guard.
Well then, back to the Morganas.
Capitano, I don't mind the occasional cliché, but I'd rather one I enjoy. Moonlight, calm seas, a little romance.
Dolphins at the hull?
Exactly! We've got our nose to the grindstone enough. We can have some nice things.
Your right. We're not losing here.
@BATTLE
Capitano, I see the Port Narrow evacuees.
They are at the border of the safe zone, but the Morganas are blockading them.
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: Full speed ahead! Break through.
This is the home stretch, Archimede.
Of course they are. Let's punch a hole.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Capitano! Moving towards their weakest section.
Sì, Capitano, let's finish this.
Full speed ahead, Capitano.
@BATTLE
They have a clear path, but are the evacuees moving through?
Sì, Capitano! They are crossing into the safe zone now.
They've been out here a lot longer than we hoped.
Command is aware of the situation. They have relief ships standing by.
The safe zone border is a blurry line. We should maintain awareness until they reach the relief ships.
Absolutely. The Morgana fleet is breaking up and moving away.
Not ready to take on an equal force?
It would appear so.
Stay salty. We can't make a mistake now.
Yes, Capitano.
Morganas in sight!
Get us on an intercept course - let's not give them any more time to cause trouble.
Sì, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Archimede, you rushed off right after the battle. Are you feeling well?
Yes, yes, it's just that... the clouds are parting.

Fields.MenuText: So they are. Is that a full moon?
Well it is nice up here. Haven't seen the ocean this calm in a while.
Full moon, calm seas. Are you...

Fields.DialogueText: Sì, it is. So, it's time to say... I have feelings for you.
Romantic, isn't it? Capitano, I have feelings for you.
I have feelings for you.
Archimede, you... wait, one moment.
What are you doing? I'm feeling a little exposed here, my words hanging in the air.
Just wait one moment...
*dolphin noises*
Eureka! You invented that?
Well, I worked with the crew. We just used your plans and followed directions.
I didn't complete the modulation for dolphin calls, so how did you tweak the...
Just pay attention for a moment. Those feelings of yours... I certainly reciprocate them.
I thought that was the case!
So, Capitano, where do we go from here?
The Port Narrow evacuees are safe. Command wants us to clean up any straggling Morganas along the border.
Sì, I knew that. I meant where do we go from here?

Fields.MenuText: Oh, I don't know. But we'll go together.
Wherever we go, we'll go together. Any ideas?
You mean you're keeping me, Archimede?

Fields.DialogueText: Happy to hear it.
I propose we stay hard at work, until we have the chance to go on a well-earned vacation...
Sì, Capitano, as long as you'll be kept.
Look at us, Archimede. Who would've thought?
Haha! I had my suspicions...
*ALARM*
Back to duty. Let's take care of these Morganas.
Yes, Capitano, but let's dispatch them as quickly as possible. I want you back off duty! *wink*
Yes, Ma'am.
